intro: Melicope trichantha, commonly known as the hairy melicope, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands, including Hawaii, Tahiti, and parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and compound leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in coastal and lowland areas, often growing in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
